Item.Review:
Pros: Obviously the low price is the most appealing point to these headphones. They produce excellent quality with sharp, crisp sound and manage to seal out external noise pretty well. Quality of mids is excellent, highs are decent, but the low notes struggle. They also manage to produce a rather good 3d stereo environment (key for gaming). They fit snugly, but comfortably, and are made of sturdy material. The construction of the headphones themselves is quite high quality, and all parts fit snugly and move well.
Cons: These headphones do lack a good amount of bass. For gaming purposes, this factor doesn't matter much, but if you're looking for mostly music listening headphones, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.
Solid pair of gaming headphones for a very low price. Sennhe ... iser makes quality products, and this is no different. Bass is definitely lacking, but for $18 it's still an excellent deal. Comfortable fit, excellent clarity, sturdy construction. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.ReviewTitle: Cheap but great bang for your buck
Item.Review:
Pros: Sounds much better than it's price would let on. Neutral sounding from the midrange and up. Pretty comfortable and breathable. Can be used for several hours wihout discomfort. Does not feel like clamp on your head like some other headphones of this size. A great headphone for every day usage and chucking around without worrying about having to baby it or someone trying to steal it.
Cons: Lacking in bass. Cord overly long, but that could be a pro as well. All plastic construction makes it feels as cheap as it's price but it feels durable as well. Cord is pretty thin as well.
I use it to listen to podcasts and music at work. Probably had around 500 hours of usage on these things and it has held up well.
Item.HelpfulCount: 3 out of 4 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones fit my head perfectly. I have around a size 7 hat size and they fit snugg. The sound quality is amazing and eventhough the bass may be lacking it is difficult to find a headset in this price range that is any better. The cord is also super long which makes moving around your computer area convenient. Not ideal for travel but if you can bundle the cord up you'll be fine.
Cons: None that I can think of. In my opinion you can't go wrong with sennheiser headphones.
For the price range you can't beat these. Pick up a pair while they're hot. At 12.99 they aren't gonna last long.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: Bargin price, they work fine
Cons: 1/4" adapter shown in "overview" tab did not arrive. The headphones just don't sound very good; no bass, hollow mids and tinny highs.
I got what I paid for, a CHEAP set of headphones...however I did not get the adapter described in the product details. This was not a huge deal but once I decided to return them I was concerned that Newegg might require the adapter as an included accessory. After a short online chat w/customer service, it was all resolved WAY beyond my expectations; I'll be a vocally loyal customer...
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: CANNOT BE BEAT FOR PRICE, OVERALL VERY EXCELLENT HEADPHONES!!!! JUST BUY EM!!!!!!!******OVERALL 10 OUT OF 10*******
Cons: NOTHING!!!
VALUE-these headphones just cant be beat for under $30. the fact that they are even priced this low blows my mind.
SOUND-it does not say they are noise cancelling, but as soon as i put them on in the car after i purchased them, i could not hear the car radio or anything. all i could hear was my music. the bass is the perfect level in my opinion, not to high and not too low. i have listened to other headphones with more bass, but they were all at least $40 more expensive. i give the sound in general a 9 out of 10.
COMFORT/STYLE/SIZE- these headphones are also the perfect size for over-ear headphones. some headphones have too m ... uch of an outwards curve, or the cup in general is too big/sticks out too much. not these headphones. they curve around my head perfectly and the cups are sleek and thin while providing great sound. the cord that is with the headphones is EXTREMELY long, i measured it with a tape measure and it came out to be just under 10ft.!!! ****MY SOLUTION WAS TO COIL IT A LITTLE AT THE PLUG (WHICH IS GENERALLY IN YOUR POCKET OR SOMETHING IF YOU ARE USING AN IPOD ANYWAY) AND TAPE THE COIL TOGETHER, MAKING THE CORD ABOUT THE SAME LENGTH AS APPLE EARBUDS.**** the long cord is not really a big issue. these headphones are REALLY comfortable. they are lightweight, which is always a plus. you might think "oh, lightweight means they might break easy" and if you say that, you are wrong. these headphones are RUGGED and DURABLE. the earpads are amazingly comfortable, as well as the leather cushion on that rests on top of your head. also some over-ear headphones to not completely fit around your ear and leave spaces in between your head and the headphones, but not these headphones. they cover all the way around your ear perfectly. (THE EARCUPS TWIST BACK AND FOURTH TO CONTOUR TO THE SURROUNDING AREA OF YOUR EAR.) OVERALL-JUST BUY THESE HEADPHONES!!! SENNHEISER HAS REALLY OUTDONE THEMSELVES AND THE COMPETITION FOR HEADPHONES THIS GOOD AT THIS PRICE!! expand » « collapse

These headphones are great, not amazing, but for the price they are simply awesome considering how clear, comfortable, and versatile the headphones are. Grab a pair and be astounded as the price is certainly not reflected in the quality of these headphones. These headphones have an amazingly lengthy cord, at least 6 feet in length and the headphones fit perfectly around my ears. The design is simple and yet it still maintains an authentic style.
Does not have a volume control but nonetheless it is an amazing piece of work. The build itself is of a hard plastic like many other headphones, but the structure of these headphones are quite sturdy and are capable of withstanding tosses here and there and obviously not a hard intentional throw into a wall.
The sound is amazing ... . When I first received the headphones I quickly unpacked it and hooked the headphones in and was astounded. The sound is so clear and the bass is not so abhorrent that it overthrows the treble. For the price, these headphones are a STEAL. I recommend any beginner or listener to grab a pair of these headphones and try them out, there will be no disappointment. expand » « collapse

Pros: Sound is crisp and satisfying. Simple design, fairly sturdy, and surprisingly comfortable. I can wear them for several hours without discomfort. They fit completely around the ears and dull background noise. Long cord if you need it. I've had them over a year, and so far they've held up just fine with daily use and moderate wear. I listen to music watch films and game with them; good all-around pair of headphones.
Cons: Bass is a bit weak, can't really feel it (really though, can't expect that at this price). Cord is almost too long. If your audio jack is not in the next room, you'll have to wind some of the extra length up so you don't trip over/get tangled in it.
No mic, obviously. This is a plus for me as I don't need/want one, so there isn't one in the way to bre ... ak/bother with. expand » « collapse

Pros: Comfortable, has padding where you want it, long cable length. Clear mids and highs; unmuddy bass. The ear pieces swivel +/- a few degrees so the whole thing fits you more comfortably, kudos very ergonomics.
Cons: No cable management, but understandable at this price range. No overwhelming bass, but quite satisfying.
I burned-in the drivers with a few hours of music before writing this review. Does not feel like it goes below 30 Hz, which is fine.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: Almost Everything, except for what's not so great.
Cons: Cheap-feeling build quality, but in reality, really solid.
If you are an audiophile, a teenager, or have a home studio, these are the headphones for you. At first I was resistant, because I am a rapper, and a lot of the reviews were negative for one reason only: not enough bass. These headphones have GREAT BASS. I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of bass that is actually in these headphones. The highs are crisp, the mids sound great, and the lows are really deep. These are the most perfectly balanced headphones that I have ever used. I would have to say at LEAST 10X better than the skullkandy ink'd earbuds. The build quality is excellent. If you like your music LOUD, then these headphones are for you. If y ... ou turn these all the way up, and put them on, you can't hear anything around you, and noone around you can hear what song you're listening to, but if you take them off, they're like speakers. Its amazing the amount of noise-isolation these have. THE BEST $30 I'VE EVER SPENT IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Comfy, but sound isn't quite there
Item.Review:
Pros: Super comfortable and lightweight.
Cons: Missing the deep bass and clear highs of the next model up - HD 202/203s. They also do not get very loud.
These things are a great buy if you're looking for something comfortable, but for a few bucks more you might as well go with the HD 202/203s. I conducted a side-by-side comparison and the HD 201s are weak in deep bass response and in the clarity of highs, but a little more comfortable than the HD 202 and HD 203. All Sennheiser headphones do not get super loud, but these don't go loud at all. I would pass on these unless you simply needed a back-up pair or something comfy.

Item.ReviewTitle: Pretty Good, but room to improve
Item.Review:
Pros: I've used these everyday for the past two months for a music tech class. Really long cord probably from 3 to 4 feet, very comfortable (use for 2 hours at a time), bass is pretty good, not too much distortion with the volume cranked. Highs are good as well as the mids.
Cons: Really the only complaint i have with these is the all plastic construction. I've been the class for the past 2 months, and all computers have these headphones and 9/30 have broken at the earpiecec where it swivels. Of course remember these are high schoolers coming through with these for 7 hours a day.
other than the all plastic construction a really great heasd phone.

Pros: Good sound, long cord, decent bass and comfortable headset. These go over my ears and over my glasses, making them quite comfortable. I can wear them for hours without any major issues. Clear crisp middles, highs were okay. Seems solid quality, rubber is good on the cord.
Cons: Weaker bass than normal, no volume control, long cord could be a con. Volume is much lower than most headphones, so you have to crank up the volume in order to get the same sound. The pair I got has a slight problem towards the 5mm output where bending a certain way gives audio problems. Not enough to do a RMA.
One thing to note: Please burn the headphones in! Right out of the box, I tested it against my Sennheiser CX300 and a friend's HD280 and found the HD 201 muddy with no bass. I left it play ... ing music over the weekend, and it brought the bass out, and clean up the middle/highs. Bass isn't as strong as what I would like, but it's stronger than HD280 (granted that pair isn't strong in the first place). The middles/highs were pretty good comparable to HD280s but HD280 are slightly better. The HD 201 now beats CX300 on every range. For the $13 price range, you're really getting your money's worth, but please, burn them in first! They're really awful right out of the box. After 40 hours of playing music, they matured to a nice pairs of can, especially for $13. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: -Sound quality is fantastic for what I paid for. (rather than 2-4 cheap earbuds at some general store, or 20 at a dollar store) -Very long cord, so I keep the tie around so it doesn't cause much trouble. -3.5mm to 1/4"(6.3mm) gold converter for guitar players or those if you need privacy when playing on a keyboard or workstation. -Good, hardy construction.
Cons: -The construction can be arguable because it's solid. Personal preferences and all that. -To get the full experience, adjust your equalizer on whatever device you use.
I got these because I needed a good and cheap pair of headphones that had the standard 3.5mm jack, so I could use an adapter for my workstation in my college piano course. This came with a gold adapter so it's working much better than ... the $1 one I picked up. For the price it sounds fantastic. I'm used to using Siberia v2's for most listening, but unfortunately they, and the rest of my headsets, required some sort of power whether USB or batteries. Overall a great buy for $20! expand » « collapse

Pros: I've had these for more than a year now and they're still going strong. These have taken a beating, they've been dropped, sat on, cords been tun over by my chair countless times, and they're still just fine; the quality of construction is top-notch. The sound quality is grand, good highs, and bass, midrange is pretty dang good too. For 18.99 these are probably the best headphones you can buy.
Cons: As with any headphones, these might not be comfortable for some; perfect fit for me though.
paid 5 bucks more for mine, looks like the price has gone down, but that's not a con for anyone else; but it's all I can think of.
Better than the more expensive DJ HD 202's, bought my sister a one of them and she's been through two. The 202's might be a little bit more comfo ... rtable for some, but the build quality isn't as good as these. I don't the sounds as rich either.
Sennheiser has great customer service, just create your RMA on their website, mail it in, and you'll get your replacement in very little time. (did this for my sister's 202's twice, haven't had to do it for these.) expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: These head phones are a great product for the price. Clear highs and deep rich bass. I use them with my Turtle Beach 5.1/7.1 surround sound system and my pc and they sound great. Solid product they can take a beating droped these many times and they did not break yet. lol
Cons: May feel a little stiff on your head at first but after I used them a while they feel really comfortable. Also I'm a lager than average person.
I had my first pair for over a year and a half and still use it. Bought a second back up because they are a bargin.

Item.ReviewTitle: I would be mad if I paid $40 for these
Item.Review:
Pros: These have a long cord, feel solid enough with build quality, doesn't project sound to nearby people
Cons: The fit is no good. The put too much pressure on the lower half of the earpiece and not enough on top. Even with adjustments there was no comfortable fit. These have sub-par bass levels and distort at low volumes. The sound sounds muffled and not crisp at all.
Had I paid full price for these I would get a refund. I'm really surprised at the decent rating for these. This is my first Sennheiser and I am disappointed. I would avoid these even if they are on sale.

Pros: The sound is very clear and full. Not really flooded with too much bass and there is a nice balance between the lows and highs. I'm by no means an audiophile but I wanted a sturdy pair of over ear headphones that I could travel with that wouldn't break the bank. This is exactly what I was looking for.
Cons: These headphones do sound a bit better when plugged into my computer vs. my iPod. I'm guessing this is because the iPod doesn't have enough power to really drive the headphones. That said, they still sound plenty good.
I got these with a promo for $13 and there just isn't anything that sounds this good that you can get for near that price. Exactly what I was looking for.

Item.ReviewTitle: 12.95 free ship no tax, u can't beat it
Item.Review:
Pros: mild bass but just right great highs and overall great sound for the price can't beat it for 13 bucks total I also own 558's
Cons: none.
i take care of my stuff, so to me its not flimsy at all

Pros: I bought these normally $50 headphones for $15 through a sale, coupled with my 2-day free shipping from ShopRunner. For the price, they were a great deal. They fit snugly and I can hardly hear surrounding noises even at a low volume.
Cons: The only reason I am giving 4 eggs is because these headphones don't have a whole lot of bass.

Pros: $12.99 on sale (I based my 2-star rating on Newegg's apparently normal $24.95 price). Some people may be entirely satisfied at the $12.99 price: they're not that BAD, they're just not that GOOD.
Pretty comfortable.
Long cord.
Cons: A bit muddy in the bass (though it is accentuated, as advertized), mid-range, and high range (the last being noticeably attenuated as well). As points of comparison, my $0.99 (on sale) ear buds from Meritline and $14.99 (on sale from $17.99) MEE HT21 headphones from Newegg are much crisper (especially in the high range): both of these (especially the first) are remarkably good for their prices and one can certainly find examples of far worse products at much higher prices, but they do provide reference points that the Sennheiser HD ... 201 just doesn't begin to approach (which surprises me, given their reputation).
My best point of reference is my Koss Pro/4 AAAs from the '70s. The HD201s list for about half what I think I originally paid for the Koss 'phones, but given 35 years of technology advance I expected them to be at least somewhat comparable in sound quality. They weren't, at all, in any respect (though they are a lot lighter and more comfortable).
I bought a pair of these on a similar sale a year ago, was disappointed, and Newegg's exceptional customer service department refunded my money. My wife just bought a second pair on sale (without my knowing it) - and they're identical in performance to the first pair (indicating that I hadn't just gotten a lemon first time around).
She's satisfied with them (though has lost some of her high-range hearing and admits that she's not that picky). You might be too. Just don't expect high-quality sound if you're looking for it. expand » « collapse

Pros: These are in my opinion the perfect headphones for their price range. The range of sound, direction, and clarity make this a must for me. After 1 hour of use I threw out my logitechs and my sony's that were disappointing me for so long. These are also very very comfortable which makes them a pleasure to use over long sessions. Just about anything I push through these sounds better than through my 5.1 system or other headphones/headsets.
Cons: I really have none.
I'll be using these for recording with my M-audio pre-amp, GemSound PL-USB, and Audio Technica AT3035's. These are in no way too loud which is exactly what I want for accurate leveling. If it sounds right with these full blast it's leveled and that type of accuracy is very hard to reach with over/under powered h ... eadphones. Sennheiser impresses me yet again.
Additionally these headphones have the slightest amount of horizontal rotation at the join which makes them a comfortable fit without any stretch stress regardless of head shape. I soooo recommend these! expand » « collapse

If you're only spending $30 you're not going to get Bose-quality. But this is a very very good set of headphones for that price. Bass is very good but sound quality across the spectrum is also really could. Very clear crisp sound. Unless you're a producer, these are great.

I read a whole lot of reviews first before buying these headphones, half thinking that other reviewers might have overstated things. How wonderfully surprised I was to found that these lived up to reviews! The sound from these is amazing! Do not hesitate for a moment, pick up a pair of these and throw away your white ear buds! You will hear a clarity and richness from your music that will astound you. Classical, Jazz, Pop and Rock all sound wonderful, but if you like a lot of punchy bass, then you might find these aren't right for you. Bass is good on these but not as powerful as others in the range. Still, these are more than decent especially when you consider the price - an absolute bargain.

Item.ReviewTitle: For $15, not bad. Anymore than that is a pass.
Item.Review:
Pros: Very long cord, perfect for work environments to keep everything clean and organized. The price was perfect at $15 with free shipping. The sound is very "crisp." For people with large heads, I can imagine this being comfortable. I have a large head, and they fit over my ears and head perfectly. Not terribad to wear.
Cons: Where's the bass? The specs claim 21hz min frequency, and my what a difference between 20hz. There is so little bass here, that it almost feels like I am listening to dollar store earbuds. I have to crank up any source these are on to get any sort of volume out of them. First listen I thought I got a defective unit. Listening to dubstep is out of the question with these.
Decent for work headphones where there is mainly just a bunch of spoken w ... ord. expand » « collapse

Pros: Low price Long cord Quality brand not "tinny" Good bass (depending on bass frequency)
Cons: Some songs sound great, while others sound flat or sorta distorted. Could be MP3 encoding. No ultra low bass, but really didn't expect that Probably not the sturdiest things you'll ever stick on your head
Overall I'm thrilled with these. Clear sound, some tracks have surprisingly good bass. For $15 bucks (newegg had a coupon) they're a heck of a bargain.
A lot of people comment on how comfortable they are, but I must have an oddly shaped head, as the feel like they're going to slide backwards all the time.

Pros: I am not an big fan in music, but this headset gives me great experience. It feels comfortable and can fit in my big head very well. It features somewhat noise isolation (my room is not noisy) and the sound is great to me in any PC games I played.
Cons: The volume is a little bit low, but not ridiculars low. the cord is too long? (maybe pros)
For this price, this is simply the best headset you can get.

Pros: Cheap, decent sound for someone who isn't worried too much about quality or bass. I found them quite comfortable. Cord is long enough to reach pretty much anywhere.
Cons: Bass is lacking, and the overall clarity isn't great. Even for a $20 set there are better headphones out there.
I was very disappointed in these headphones. I have another pair of Plantronics that I bought somewhere else for about the same price a couple years ago, and decided to "upgrade" to the Sennheiser's. Unfortunately, these aren't even close in sound quality. They fit better and are more comfortable and solid, but the other pair, despite not covering my ears completely, provides amazingly better bass than these and overall much clearer sound without tweaking the equalizer at all. I did as ... much tweaking as I could to try and make the Sennheiser's match the other cheap pair, but despite everything I've heard about the Sennheiser name, they just don't match up. It's a shame because they feel like they're built a lot more solid. I'm not an audiophile, so I just expected something to match my old headphones but with better build quality and fit. These made me realize that sound quality is more important. I will be shelling out more cash in the future to get something decent. expand » « collapse

These are a great set of cans for the prices. The sound is fine, bass is reasonable. Very good fit and very comfortable.
However they are NOT as listed. They are not Noise Cancelling headphones.
Still at this prices, who cares!!

Pros: These are good 'phones. They're pretty comfortable and the audio is solid. Not much is lost from recordings with these.
Cons: The bass is heavy. I haven't burned them in totally yet, but I've listened to pairs owned by friends and they are bass heavy too. It does muddle the highs to some degree.
If you need tons of bass and decent clarity in an entry level set of headphones, these are good for you.

Pros: The fit nicely your head. Great coverage over the ears. Great sound and descent bass. Descent look to them.
Cons: None really, for the price they are very good headphones for use. If I had to nit-pick one thing, it'd be that there is a cord that leaves each speaker rather than have it just be a single cord leaving the unit to the jack.
I bought these from the review I read on Newegg and for the price point they were at. Overall I am very pleased with them. They fit good and sound great. I use my headset mostly to listen to internet radio on my smartphone while walking the dog. I recommend these for a nice secondary or backup pair if you want something around the house.

excellant headphones for the price.. had never heard of this make before but no need to worry.
great sound reproduction normally associated with much more expensive headphones.
a longer lead that many headphones too makes this an excellant all rounder

Pros: Cheap, reliable, made by Sennheiser, one of the most credible and prestigious in the Audiophile community.
2 Year Warranty.
Powerful, full sound with a very tight knit bass response, and very crisp highs. Mids aren't the strong point, but are definitely there.
Cons: A little small on the earcups,
These beat my old JVC Harx900's I bought.
Buy Sennheiser, you will not be disappointed.

Pros: Although not the best deal on the net, these can's can definitely be seen as carrying a nice and light price tag, especially for circumaural headphones. Decent mid-tones.
Cons: Biggest flaw in my ears was not only the complete lack of bass, but the static that replaced the absence of bass. On deep bass filled songs, not rap or hip-hop, the bass reproduction was ugly at best, with static easily noticeable even at low volume. A smaller but equally annoyingly problem was the maximum size of the headband itself. All my life I've known I've had a rather big head, but never have I had an uncomfortable experience with headphones.
I picked these up on sale elsewhere for a little under $20, and now after giving my ears a listen, I understand why a company would have to stoop ... to such a low price to get rid of them. In the end I would compare the sound of these can's to those you can find, for cheaper, at truck-stop's along I-75. expand » « collapse

Pros: I've paid much more for headphones that were significantly worse than these. Wonderful quality, clear sound, decent bass. And you can't beat the price! Definitely pleased with this product.
Cons: Bass is clear, but not earth-shaking. This doesn't bother me, but people who really value their bass might dislike it.
If you're looking for cheap, quality headphones, look no further and buy these. One of the best in their price range.

Pros: Price, comfort, sound.
Cons: No complaints for the price.
Most of the reviews for these headphones were very good, but there were a few reviewers who complained that the bass response was poor. I use them with my IPOD Classic and the bass is excellent. The sound is crisp and clear, and the headphones are comfortable. Yesterday I wore them for four hours while working in my yard and I experienced no discomfort. The cord is a little long, so I wound it up and secured it with the wire tie and tucked it in my pocket. I'm very pleased with this purchase and recommend these headphones to anyone who doesn't want to spend one to three hundred dollars for a high end pair.

Pros: very comfortable and light: I can wear these ALL day without pain or ears overheating. The sound is what I expected for the price; fairly crisp with just good enough bass. Price. Noise reduction... I'd say it cuts out a third of the ambient noise with my smaller than average head pushing against the pads. DURABLE. I've had big problems with speakers dying on previous headphones within a month of purchase.
And of course, great service from the egg.
Cons: none at this price.
They're cheap headphones so you're not going to think you suddenly stepped into symphony hall. But for the average buyer like me who isn't much of an audiophile, these are great and have as much sound quality as I want for games, movies etc. If these 201s die I won't hesitate to buy ... another pair.
And I'd rather have a cord too long than too short. You can always bundle part of it up and tie it off... expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review: I use a variety of headphones in my studio and I needed an extra pair for use with drums. These phones are lightweight and offer excellent sound quality for the money. That said, I was hoping for better sound isolation. When I use these while playing drum set or percussion it is quite difficult to hear what I am tracking over the outside noise from the drums. Compared to my Sennheiser HD280's the isolation is almost non-existent. Unfortunately, the HD280's are just too heavy for active drumming (they are fine for everything else). I will continue to use my Bose Tri-ports for tracking drums due to their light weight and fairly good isolation. The HD201 is a great value as long as isolation is not a factor.

Pros: Great set of headphones for people on a budget. I've had them for about 2 years and their still in good condition. I haven't ripped the black cord yet, (like I did to my last pair) but the cord feels strong and well attached to the headphones, so I'm not too worried about that. They sound good and fit on my head comfortably. It also came with an adapter which is nice for connecting to other things that don't have the original connector.
Cons: The black cord is a bit long.. not a problem for me, but I'm sure someone out there might be bothered by this.
During the holidays (last Christmas), I had bought these for a relative as a gift. He enjoyed them and told me it had good sound and decent bass. Got them on sale here for less than $20 at the time. Nice

Pros: These are a good set of headphones. They fit comfortably over the ear and do not cause discomfort if worn for extended periods of time. The sound quality is really good, although I could use a little more bass than they output. The cord is pretty long, and I've had no trouble with excessive tangling.
Cons: Like I said above, the bass is lacking a little. Other than that, I can't really complain about much. The padding on the earphones could be a little thicker to pull the speaker a little further from your ear, but it's still quite comfortable as is.
I'm quite happy with my purchase of these headphones. As a programmer, I can appreciate a good pair with a good comfort factor. I wouldn't mind having a couple more pairs so I don't have to transport them from work to home. ... For a relatively low-cost set of headphones, I don't think I could have done much better. expand » « collapse

Pros: The only reason I am giving this 5 eggs is because of the money. I got these for 12.99 with free shipping. Otherwise, I would probably take off an egg. They aren't the best headphones I've ever had but if you can get them for short money they are a great deal. The bass is decent and the overall sound was better than I expected.
Cons: Cheap material. Probably should be careful with them.

Item.ReviewTitle: So comfortable, great for mixing/everyday use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort, even mix, price.
Cons: Very long cord.
So comfortable, great for mixing due to its even mix - Not bass heavy like more expensive models, just clear sound. Great for everyday use - Laptop, cell phone, and MP3 player all sound good. Less fatigue and bigger sound than comparable earbuds. Love 'em.

Pros: 1. Sound quality is very good for the price. My previous headphones was a pair of vertical Sony MDR-A34 headphones that I bought about 10 years ago. That Sony unit was not that bad to begin with, and actually probably the best vertical headphone unit for the price at that time. Nonetheless, it was easy to notice important differences. HD201 gives you more feeling of space. If you play hip hop music, you will also notice better bass presence. It's easier to spot or discern secondary or background noises or instruments. The most discernible improvement is when playing FPS (first person shooter) games. Here, I can see pretty big advantages in terms of sound quality. The old headphones emphasized for the most part the noisiest sound of the moment, while with HD201 I can hear multiple les ... s loud secondary noises and sounds.
2. The unit is lightweight.
3. Price is right. I got these for $20 with shipping.
Cons: 1. The cord is ridiculously long. It's approximately 11 feet long. Perhaps this is useful for people whose comfy chair is about that far from their stationary stereo system, but it's terrible for PC audio users. Expect the cord to get entangled with every cord on, below, or near your desk, and expect to run over this cord with your office chair.
2. And now, the BIGGEST con of these headphones, and the primary reason I give them 3 instead of 5. The cushions that go around your ear are probably less than half inch thick. This means that even people with normal sized ears will feel pressure of headphone's speakers on their ears when wearing these. The pressure is pretty high. To make the matters worse, the part that comes in contact with your ear is hard plastic. When wearing these for less than an hour, this is not a big problem. If you keep them on for longer, expect lots of irritation and pain. Overall, this is a pretty big issue. They simply become uncomfortable after playing a CD
The sound quality is pretty good, but these headphones can't be worn with comfort for long periods of time. I had these for less than a week, but I can already see clearly that these headphones cannot be my main unit, and I have to look for something else. If these headphones were more comfortable, I would gladly pay $50-60 for them, but as is, they're not worth more than $30.
I'll give them 5 for sound quality which is probably the best for the price, and 1 for comfort, which results, after taking the average of the two, in a 3 on the 5 point scale. expand » « collapse

Pros: These are pretty decent for the price I paid $13. Have good sufficient bass and better treble.
Cons: No cons as such, but the length of the cable is so long, it would have been good if they provided a holder clip or something.

Pros: Crazy good value
Cons: Not quite there compared to other similar products.
Given their sub $30 price, the headphones are really good. Good dynamic range, good seal around the ears, not punishingly loud. But there are so many awesome headphones priced just a little bit higher, so its hard to recommend them, even though I found the build quality to be up to sennheiser's usual high standards (although I've only had them for a week so YMMV).
Would be a great gift, or pair of "starter" headphones for someone who wants to hear what music is supposed to sound like when its not on a $3 pair of earbuds.

Pros: Lightweight, long cord, no sound quality Pro's at all.
Cons: These sound worse than every other set of headphones I own including wireless. No bass or depth what so ever. I may have gotten a bad set as I have tested with multiple sources and these are hands down worse then a cheap set of ear buds from Walmart. When I purchased I was basing the decision on the reviews which was unfortunate as these have awful sound quality.
Save your Money and buy a good set of noise cancelling headphones.

Pros: Love these headphones bought them over a year ago when they went on sale for 12 bucks. Best 12 pesos I have ever spent. They have survived in my bookbag unprotected and I have dropped them multiple times and they still keep ticking. I listen to about 80% Podcast (Joe Rogan and Adam Carolla) and 20% music. I plug these babys into my evo 4g and then go about my day. I wear them on average about 3 hours every day. Build quality is fantastic and the sound quality exceeded my 12 dollar expectations. They do lack some punch when you listen to the hippity hop but I can't knock it to hard for the price I paid.
Cons: This is a pro for most but a con for me and the way I use the headphones. This cord is LONG like 6 feet long. Also as mentioned above the bass is lacking.
Wait for ... these baby's to go on sale and then pick up a few pair! expand » « collapse

Pros: $13 on sale. 5 star value and performance. Inexpensive and sound great with Chu Moy headphone amp.
Cons: Not a con but require extra volume level or maybe a headphone amp to drive properly.

Item.ReviewTitle: A good value, if you have sane expectations.
Item.Review:
Pros: Really long cord. Fit my big head. High sensitivity (meaning, it doesn't take a lot of power to drive them). Cheap, cheap, cheap. The sound quality isn't irritating. Good for plugging into the computer late at night, so as not to disturb the roommate.
Cons: Vinyl-clad padding gets icky with sweat, quickly. Wish it was terry-cloth or somesuch. (If they had that extra bit of comfort, I'd bump them to 5 stars.)
I picked these up for under $15, including shipping. Do they sound awesome? No. But if I wanted over-the-ear headphones that sound awesome I'd spend the money for some Grados.
If you want quality sound reproduction for under $15, you won't find it in *any* over-the-ear 'phones. Go look at canal 'phones (sub-class of "earbuds"), instead--you can som ... etimes find cheap 'phones of that type that do a decent job. expand » « collapse

Pros: The quality is amazing. When the beat dropped on one song I've listened to a million times, it was like listening to a new song entirely.
EXTREMELY comfortable. Between my odd-shaped head and my big ears, headphones are usually painful after long periods of time. I didn't feel like I was wearing headphones at all, even after long periods of time. They don't dig into my jawbone either, like some headphones.
Cons: The sound is actually quite low, though it might be because they're not bass-boosted like most headphones on the market (my last headphones were Skullcandy Hesh, VERY bassy). When listening to my music on my iPhone, I have to turn it up to 90% to get the same amount of volume from 50% before. It's the same with my computer as well. I have to turn up the volume t ... o 88% to get near the 20% I used to have.
The cord is extremely long. While that's great for when I'm gaming and I need to get up and grab something, I have no idea how to control it when I'm walking around town and listening to music. I honestly would have preferred an extension cord over a 9' long cord.
I think I'm just used to headphones with the bass boosted way up, so I had to really try every kind of genre of music before I could formulate a proper opinion. If you're used to Beats or Skullcandys, don't be quick to judge.
Despite the cons, I'd still recommend them for anyone wanting clear, comfy headphones for half the price of most brand names. In a month of hard wear and tear, I'll be sure to update this review. expand » « collapse

Pros: Cost. Quality for the money spent. Extra long cord (to some that's a nuisance though). Pretty comfortable for long periods of listening. Top of head cushion which certainly doesn't come on all headphones in this price range.
Cons: Not enough bass. Though I don't mind so much as I like more treble than bass, but sometimes you want that punch and it's not there if you're really into that sound. A little bleed out of sound. If you crank up the Zeppelin, your neighbors will be jamming to Bonzo too. Cord seems a little cheap (shocker on a $13 pair of phones).
All that said, for the money spent these phones sound really good, and I enjoy them for hours at a time at work on low to medium volume. If you are looking for top-notch sound quality, spend some mo ... re $ on a higher level set of phones, but Sennheiser has impressed me on their whole line of headphones. expand » « collapse

Pros: Biggest pro is how sturdy they are, they can take a ton of abuse. They are also decent quality for the price you pay.
Cons: Bass is absolutely terrible. Listened to the same song on these and another pair of headphones (that are cheaper) and could instantly tell a difference. Not comfortable, my ears get sore pretty easily.
Buying some new headphones because I really dislike the sound quality of these. Everything that comes out of them sounds like someone pumped up the treble and it gives me a headache.

Pros: Cheap price, long cable, comfortable.
Cons: Muffled bass, flat response, makes music sound terrible.
I did compare to VModa and Bose headphones, and could not stand these headphones.

Pros: I believe I bought these for $13.99 with a promo code. They sound great for the price. They look durable.
Cons: They lack bass. Not as much bass as I expected.
I bought two pairs. As I said they are nice headphones, but they lack some bass. The long cord is not an issue for me.

Pros: Cheap. Probably as good as you can get for sub-$20 headphones.
Cons: Midrange sounds completely terrible. Games sound horrible. Sound effects are one dimensional. Highs and lows sound alright and if anything these are too bassy when they shouldn't be bassy, but the midrange sounds like I'm listening through a tin can.
Volume is also low so you'll need to crank them up.
If you are thinking about getting these for gaming then don't. Save your money and get something better. My desktop speakers produce more accurate sounds for gaming than these headphones, but it's harder to determine positioning with speakers. These headphones do alright with positioning.
To put this simply if you want these for games then don't waste your money; get something else.

Pros: Nice looking and big earphones. The cable is above average long and the plug looks high quality gold.
Cons: They sound cheap and without much bass. The earphones don't rotate much and you cant tell which is right or left.
I took a shot at trying these and I was disappointed. I have some skullcandy headphones that I bought recently for about the same price-$15ish. I compared the two and the Skullcandy headphones blew these out of the water even though judging by only the appearance the Sennheiser headphones look nicer. I have had Sennheiser headphones that sounded much better than these. Don't judge a book by its cover or brand name.

Pros: -Great price (bought them on sale) -Comfortable!!! -Incredible sound
Cons: -Cord is very long (not a con for many, but if you plan on sitting at your computer, the cord will hang to the floor)
Solid pair of headphones. Sound is great for the price and the comfort makes them easy to wear for long periods of time.

Pros: Very long cord about 5 foot long. The sound for price comparison can't be beat. I use these for my Alesis Pro electronic drum set and the sound is actually one of the best (next to running through the PA system). Even the 808 kick sounds fairly good. No you won't get head rattling bass, but what do you expect from headphones? The fit is very adjustable (they fit me fine and can be adjusted to fit my 7 year old just as well). I actually bought a second pair and let my kids use them in the car to watch their movies.
Cons: The only con I can think of is the lower end of the sound spectrum isn't the greatest, although they do a very good job.
For the price you can't beat these headphones. Unless you are looking for noise cancelling or a high end studio monitor these are t ... he best buy for your hard earned dollars. expand » « collapse

Pros: Price - I got them for a great deal to replace some cheap headphones that have worked wonderful over the last few years. The cans still work, just the headband broke, so I needed to find replacements.
Cons: These are just very uncomfortable to me! The Phillips streach ones I got to replace these are much more comfortable. However uncomfortable to one person is just fine to another, and just fine for one person is uncomfortable with another so...
I use the over the ear headphones to watch TV at night so I do not disturbe anyone else. I could care two rats hind ends about perfect sound, all I want is to hear what I'm watching. These fit the bill, but comfort is really important to me as well. I've tried 50 dollar Kickers, and they pushed too hard on my head, so I decided ... to go cheap and I tried these and they were much better but the inside of the cans rested on my ears. Then I just went to a store to try on a few different ones and found the streach ones to be very comfortable, not to mention the semi flat design is great when you forget your wearing them and roll over in bed. It actually works without putting EXTREME pressure against the side of your head. Of course having anything between your pillow and head is going to be noticable, but it wasn't uncomfortable! I think they are the best choice for my needs. These sennheiser's will just be emergency headphones if anyone needs to borrow them. expand » « collapse

Best fo da mo nay. Great for mixing, but they do not portray bass appropriately. But you may not find another pair of headphones for this price that sounds as clean, clear, and beautiful as these. Feel very comfortable. They don't have "crisp" bass response. The bass is actually quite weak, but the headphones are pretty flat sounding so they're good for recording/mixing. They're not the loudest, though (too high ohms, maybe?) Best for the price you can buy, I believe.

Pros: Sound amazing (compared to my old junk), cheap, comfortable, light, Sennheiser!
Cons: Don't feel too solid, make my ears kind of hot...
Got these for $15 after rebate and free shipping, so I'm already happy. I listened to a track I've heard a hundred times and discovered new sounds thanks to these, but my previous audio devices sucked big time. These are not going to bump your dub or rap bass until your deaf so forget about that but they still play loud and also block out noise decently. I have used them for gaming as well and I am pleased. Just today fell asleep with them on and woke up and my ears felt fine, but sometimes my ears get a little hot, maybe because the fit is perfect over my ears.

Pros: Decent sounding headphones, long cord, and good build quality
Cons: Don't expect sennheiser quality audio from these. Highs sound a little harsh and lack bass.

Pros: low cost, decent sound, durable product, really long cord.
Cons: Some crackling occurs during deep bass, rumbling (like in Amnesia) or other volume spikes. Do not know if it is my PC or the headphones though. Start to feel pressure spots after an hour or so wearing it.
Not an audiophile and little experience with sound equipment, but these phones were well worth the investment.

Pros: We purchased 5 of these (maximum was 5 per customer, believe me I would have purchased 30 if I could have) when they were on sale for 14.99 from Newegg. I work for a public library, and we provide these to our 20 public computers for patron use.
Right out of the box, I could tell that these were much higher quality than the cheap Cyber Acoustics headphones that we purchased before. In fact, I have had 2-3 CA headphones die right out of the box, no such problems with the Sennheiser brand. Sound quality is above average, and definitely high for what we paid for them. Construction feels comfortable and sturdy. The #1 pro about them that I have seen was the durability, which is important for us, since they are in use for 8-12 hours per day 6 days per week, and on the heads of pat ... rons that usually don't care if they break.
Cons: Sale is over, they are now $25 headsets again. I will not be purchasing more at this price, simply because our budget doesn't allow me enough room to spend that much. I do think they are worth it though.
I would not purchase these for home use, mainly because of no microphone, however they were a great choice for our public PCs at work because our patrons do not need microphones. expand » « collapse

Pros: Best headphones for $13. Balanced sound (bass is not abnormally loud). Very comfortable, especially for people with big ears. Looks decent as well.
Cons: Doesn't provide a good seal; therefore, you can hear outside noise very easily. Volume output is lower than other headphones which can pose problems if you like your music really loud.
I also have a pair of HD 202 II. The HD 202 II sounds much louder (when listening at the same volume levels). It also seals your ears much better from outside noise. The downside to the HD 202 II is it has way too much bass, and is uncomfortable for big ears and long periods of use. It also ugly, and I would never use them in public.

Pros: No heavy bass, very long cord, light weight.
Cons: Feel too loose on my melon, which is not tiny. Also, they feel a bit on the cheap side.
Looks like quality tester "Mr. Colossal Melon Head" tested mine before they left the factory and he wore them longer than he needed too. I needed a long cord and I certanly did get it. I like them, for 12.99 before tax they are worth it. I have had many headset and by far the best have been my Plantonics GameCom 377 but those are around 40-45 bucks. These are for the LIvingroom and I have no need for a Mic hense, they are a good fit for my needs. One egg off for feeling so loose on my head.

Pros: Sound quality for the price(especially on sale: a STEAL at $15 and free shipping). Durability: countless accidental cord snags, pulls and roll-overs with the computer chair and no damage/effect. Comfortable for an over-the-ears headphone: after a couple days of break-in(will be tight-fitting out of the box).
Cons: Extra long cord: way too long! This could actually be considered a pro if you need to move around with the headphones attached to a stationary device.
I've had a pair of these for 3 years and only purchased a second pair after the 'skin' on the foam padding surrounding the ears began flaking. The old pair still sounding great after heavy, daily use(mostly music). Obviously not intended for the audiophile, but still offering very good sound reproduction.

Pros: GREAT Sounding headphones for the price. My intent on buying these entry level speakers was to determine if I should invest $100-150 in their higher level models.
Cons: I've purchased two of these headphones now, and had an "Ok" experience with my first set - the second set were defective upon opening (one speaker blown).
Without applying even my full body weight, the first set broke EASILY when I accidentally sat on them. Due to the type of plastic, superglue did not work.
The second set came out of the box defective, and I'm highly disappointed with the quality control department at Sennheiser, a company who attempts to separate itself on quality.
Wouldn't purchase from this company again.

Pros: Clear crisp sound, long cable, comfortable even after several hours of gaming, great price.
Cons: Long cable may be a bit TOO long ... its ideal for sitting across the room from a TV but gets in the way at my desk.
Wires connect to both ear-pieces which can be annoying.
Considering the price I paid for these they are fantastic headphones ... worlds better then most bottom feeder models in bargain stores for example.
On the other hand my 10 year old Sennheiser HD490's blow the daylights out of them but of course they cost quite a bit more even in 2001.
Bottom line remember these are economy headphones and you should be happy with them as I am.

Just got these in. I usually have to buy a set of headphones about once a year, with 4 kids is a wonder they even last that long. I usually buy the cheaper ones because of that.
For the price, they are fantastic. They offer a well balanced output. I didn't find them weak on the low end side. They fit over the ear comfortably, and have a plenty long enough cord. Overall sound is great! I can't wait till these break to buy another set.

Pros: Quite comfortable; not too tight/doesn't smash ears. Beautiful lightweight design, without being flimsy. Doesn't distort audio; no need for an extra EQ. Very large frequency range. Good maximum volume. Great price
Cons: The cable is quite long, (almost 10 feet), a pro for me, but others might find it annoying to have the excess dragging along with them. The wires are thin, about the size of standard iPod ones.
Overall a GREAT buy for everyday iPod listeners, and gamers alike. Surprised the quality I got for this great a price. Used these to play Crysis 1, and could hear every leaf move, and every step taken; a definite advantage when you're sneaking around ;)

Pros: These headphones sound amazing. Booming' bass, crisp highs, and a great mid-range.
People who are looking to buy these headphones I highly recommend using a receiver to power them. When I first had this set I wasn't too impressed when plugging them straight into my computer. Then I plugged them into my receiver, What a drastic change that was (they come with an adapter for large jacks). The sound was a lot more full, you can FEEL the sound... It's an odd feeling but really cool. Trust me they get LOUD too when you have them powered right. If you know what you're doing you can get these going. Trust me, I listen to anything from classical to dubstep, movies to games, and it all sounds great.
These are over the ear headphones, which are the ONLY kind of headphon ... es that don't bother my ears after listing for a while. Sometimes I can't feel them at all.
Cons: As far as noise canceling I suppose they could be better, however I usually have these things up so high I couldn't hear someone scream in my face even if I wanted to. More importantly they keep the sound IN the headphones well which is a good thing since I like them loud.
It has a very long cord. Which I like but some people may get annoyed with. Not very practical for Ipod use, it'll drag on the ground if you let it.
Anyone who complains about the Bass either has a bad sound source or they don't know what bass SHOULD sound like. Of course they won't sound like two 12" Car subs... what headphones ever produce bass like that anyway?
These sound better than any other headphones I've ever used EXCEPT for my new ones. Which are also Sennheisers :) Just a newer (more expensive) model.
FInal Thought: Best Headphones for a tight budget you're going to find. No exceptions. :) expand » « collapse

Pros: I've been shopping from newegg for the past ~8 years and have written 1 other review. I just felt like I HAD TO share my experience about these headphones. I can't believe what some of the other reviewers are saying about the quality of these. From the sturdy construction, the super comfortable earpads, to the BREATHTAKING sound quality. I am currently listening to dubstep right now, and it sounds amazing. Deep lows, perfect meds, and crisp highs. I bought these headphones because I am on a budget and just needed something to replace my cheap skullcandy earbuds that I lost. These completely surpass my expectations. I am extremely happy with my purchase and can definitely recommend these to anyone.
Cons: The 9 foot cord maybe? I just twist tied it to shorten it up, so it's not ... a big deal for me.
I am using these headphones on my computer with a Creative Soundblaster Audigy 4 sound card + Onkyo 6.1 home theatre receiver, so I am able to amp the sound up a bit. I did however try them out on my Droid X and the music sounded great on there too. I can't compare these to $500+ headphones because I've never had anything other than cheap earbuds and random ~$20 headphones/headsets. I feel like the overall quality/comfort/sound quality from these just can't be beat especially for the $15 I paid for them. expand » « collapse

Pros: Decent sound quality. Comfy Long cord
Cons: Low signal noise ratio. iPod at full volume will not deafen you. This could be a positive but don't expect noise shattering volume.
These have pretty good overall sound quality. Don't expect them to compare to higher end models, but for $15, they are a good buy. They get a bit louder when hooked to a reciever, but iPod can be maxed out.

Pros: I didn't have much anticipation for these economical headphones which I intended to use at home with my laptop but quite impressed with performance and sound range. I don't have false hope of noise reduction, etc. just good frequency range and comfortable fit which it provides everything.
Cons: For the price there is none!

Pros: I'm a college student on a budge, so these headphones were really attractive based on price. Normally I buy cheap things, but this time I was really impressed with the value of the headphones for only $18. I was playing Counter-Strike today for the first time with these headphones, and they greatly increased my performance (over no headphones). They are great for hearing in-game footsteps. I've been wearing the headphones on and off for about 10 hours, and my ears don't hurt at all. Once I got the strap-things adjusted they fit me perfectly.
The noise canceling effect is startling. They completely (or almost completely) cover your ears, so that everything else is muffled.
As far as volume, I've had no difficulty increasing to very high levels.
The super ... -long cord is also really great.
Cons: After wearing these for over 10 hours (on and off) today, I have a little bit of a headache which I attribute to the noise-canceling effects. The noise of my computer humming and other ambient noises are being drowned out, which messes with my sense of balance, but you will probably have this problem with most headphones.
really great value, I would recommend these to anyone on a budget.
Using Windows 7 with an Audigy 2 ZS sound card, no problem with getting the volume high enough. expand » « collapse

I use these for traveling with my ipod. I have another high end model for my djing which are obviously better, but the HD201 series are great for the money. They feel sort of light and cheap but have good sound quality and decent isolation for the price. The ear pads are very comfortable and fit well. After a while you hardly notice you are wearing them. I would definitely buy these again.

Pros: Nice long cable with 3.5mm tip is great for iPods and phones. I have some Grado SR-80 headphones that are better (and much more expensive), but they have a 1/4inch plug, which means I have to use an adapter with most portables.
These Sennheisers don't distort, are super light, and fit my giant skull.
Cons: Poor bass response. Terrible for headphones of this size and style. Also, generally not very loud at all. With these Sennheisers plugged into my iPod and turned up to maximum volume, they are only as loud as my other headphones turned up to about 60-70%. If you are worried about your children damaging their ears, these are a good choice, because there is no way anyone could turn these up loud enough to cause damage.
I bought these on sale for half off with fre ... e shipping (and they arrived in 48 hours!), and they are probably the best I've used at that price, but they aren't great. They don't fold up into a small space, so maybe not great for stashing in a bag, but you probably knew that already. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: You get what you pay for
Item.Review:
Pros: Stylish
Cons: Absolutely no bass, EXTREMELY LOW VOLUME, very stiff ear cushions (might as well be the same plastic as the rest of the casing).
There's a reason these are the cheapest Sennheisers. I read so many reviews that said they had super low volume and thought "eh, they're probably fine"... but you have to have these cranked up to about 80 on an iPod before they're acceptable. It would be unfair to compare them to Bose tri-ports, or even the no-longer produced Sennheiser HD 487s, so I would compare these to the similarly priced Sony pair you can pick up at any office supply stores...except those are nothing BUT bass... these have no bass whatsoever. I feel stupid buying these, even for fifteen, but they are acceptable for using at a computer I suppose. They do ... n't isolate sound very well either. Ugh, just don't buy these. Trust me. expand » « collapse

Pros: Very, very cheap. Good enough sound quality. Solid construction. I've had these for about a year and they're just as good now as when I got them way back when.
For the price, and for someone who is not an audiophile, these are perfect.
Cons: Kinda low bass, not an outstanding sound in general. Not for audiophiles.
Not the greatest sounding cans in the world; but really, it's $20 with free shipping. What more do you want?

Pros: Overall good sound quality. Excellent bass when equalizer is adjusted. Has a sturdy structure for its low cost. Everything is intact and firmly secured. The 6.3mm adapter is nice for plugging into amps. Isn't gaudy. I've seen some annoyingly flashy head phones that don't look aesthetically pleasing at all. Adjustable sizes to fit for head.
Cons: Hearing some semi-frequent clicks, but that's just on my computer. It was fine on my mp3 player. Have seen better ear pads but these are adequate for pricing. Would have preferred all black, but then again, I'm bias against color.
Great low cost headphones. Newegg once again has lower prices then other competitors, and efficient shipping.

Pros: So far i have tested this headset with the following devices. my ipod which this was a primary buy for hasn't sounded better with great sound reproduction. The 6.3mm jack is being used for my amp since i play the bass and don't want to disturb anyone. Also tried it on CSS and i could tell from what direction footsteps were coming from with ease. After three hours of gaming i hardly felt like they were on my head they are so comfortable. The construction is like all the other Sennheiser products. Sturdy, well-thought out, comfortable and durable.
Cons: Non that i observed

Pros: These headphones have served me well for about a year. So much so that when my brother wanted a pair of headphones for his birthday I ordered him these.
Sound: Sound is good, not fabulous but the best I have heard for headphones in this price range.
Cord length: Finally! a pair of headphones that can plug into a computer that is on the ground and not have to buy an extender for.
Fit: I am a big guy, with a big head ( hat size 8). These fit perfectly, the ear cups are a little smaller than my previous Sony's. But they do not bother my ears at all, and fit comfortably over them.
Lasting: So far after a year of use they are still holding up well, the cord seems to hold up exceptionally well to my repeated rolling over with my office chair. < ... br>Cons: Cord length could be an issue for some. I have to tie the extra cord up with on my desktop computer.
My old sony's lasted for 8 years and cost me $20... So far these are on the same track. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Great Headphones for the Price Range
Item.Review:
Pros: If you're looking for something better in it's price range you are not going to find anything, I swear.
These headphones are way more comfortable than anything I've worn in this price range and actually rival in comfort pretty solidly to my Ultrasones with fleece fabric... those guys are too tight on my head.
The sound is perfect for gaming, music listening and movies.
Cons: The highs are not as crisp as I'd have liked so if you want these for audio referencing then I'd go with something in the price range of the Sony MDR-V6 or Audio-Technica's ATH-AD700.
Now that I think about it I've only had them for a day and they are not really broken in at all, if the highs get better I'll let you guys know.
If you're a true audiophile and need something for t ... ravel then these are your best bet.
These replaced my Koss TD85's when they went on sale for 19.99 plus free shipping. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Really good headphones for the price
Item.Review: I orginally bought skullcandy hesh. After listening to those for 30 minutes. I had to take them back for 60 dollar headphones. They are very uncomfortable. I went back to best buy, returned them and got these. These headphones where in a 60 dollar spot, but overall im so glad I didnt pay attention. For 30 dollar headphones, these kill the skullcandy hesh in comfortablity, durability, and sound. These are so comfortable its like u dont even know they are on. I do have one con on these. Thats the cord, its easily 9-10 feet long. I do understand these are dj headphones but they could add 10 dollars for these in price andput a quick disconnect setup, with a normallength and just have a extention setup. Its not a dealbreaker though. The sound is amazing. The bass is so clean, and overall pretty ... well balanced. The skullcandys have more bass but the really distort the sound. Overall, if u need a good pair of headphones. These are perfect for the price. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Good sound, lightweight, comfortable, but low volume
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight, comfortable fit, accurate mids and highs, attractive yet understated design
Cons: Low volume
This is my third pair of Sennheisers, I also have HD 280 Pro (for computer & TV watching at home and my amateur DJ gigs), & HD 202 (for work, bought these 201s to replace them). Compared to the ~8 year old HD 202s I have these are slightly lighter weight and more comfortable. Sound quality is very good but a little less bass (HD 202s are advertised as having enhanced bass). The only problem is at 24 Ω the HD 201s need to be turned up the volume quite a bit higher than I did on my HD 202s (32 Ω) to achieve the same loudness. FYI neither the 201 or 202s compare to the loudness of the 280s, but the 280s (64 Ω) are an entirely different class of headphones and ... it's not fair to directly compare them.
If you like louder headphones & more bass, I'd go with the HD 202s. If you want something more accurate and comfortable I think the HD 201s are a good choice. Both sets do a marginal job of blocking out a little background noise. expand » « collapse

Pros: Well articulated mids & highs. Good sound isolation & quite comfortable for long term listening.
Cons: A little lacking in the bottom end but that's to be expected so no deduction.
Bought a set for the wife; kids like them so much I have to buy another set. I use the HD 280 myself.

Pros: Nothing
Cons: sound. fits poorly
Terrible product. The picture on the packaging shows a guy wearing the headphones OVER his dread locks and a knit cap. This is the only way these phones will fit, otherwise you will have a space the size of your finger berwen your ear and the phones. I always though the oversized phones were to block out surrounding noise. These will block nothing. For a moment I actually considered wearing a headband OVER the phones,, lol
Sound quality is extremely poor unless you use your hands to push them against your ears. Kind of like holding your cell phone 1 inch from your ear-- not good. Even so, my free SONY mp3 player earbuds sound much better.
I bought these primarily because of the 3 meter cord for use with an electronic drum s ... et. However, the cord seemed flimsey like it wouldn't last. expand » « collapse

Pros: Got it on sale for a decent price. The audio that comes out of these headphones are more crisp and clear than bassy.
Cons: Starts to hurt my ears after long periods of use.....but that's it.

Pros: Absolutely nothing
Cons: Sound quality, lack of bass/treble, no snugness.
These headphones are NOT worth the money, my old $20 headphones did a better job. They have poor sound quality and no bass or treble at all, I had to turn my MP3 player all the way up and still no bass. They were not snug at all either, they should have been seeing that they were on the smallest setting. Please do not waste your money, these are basically worthless.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review: Bought these a few weeks ago and I have to say that they have surprised me with the quality of sound. Great bass sound without it being overpowering. I searched for info on these before I purchased them and the reviews on here and elsewhere on the net all agreed on the quality of these headphones. You simply cannot go wrong for the price you get them for.

Pros: Comfortable, light weight, long 10' cord, has adapter for 1/4" jack, VERY clean full range sound to high sound levels - including deep bass. PRICE!
Cons: none
As an audiophile that knows audio specifications, I am pleasantly surprised that these headphones actually live up to their specs. at this price. As a DJ from the 60's, I'm used to high end Koss & KLH headphones w/liquid filled around-the-ear pads. This headset is so much lighter. Can wear them for hours. Quick standard shipping by Newegg.

Good sound and build quality for the price. A bit lacking in bass, but that's better than the overblown sloppy bass that you get on a lot of other headphones in this price range.
They cut out a lot of high-frequency background noise - so they're good if you're sitting next to a noisy fan (like me) - but they aren't noise-cancelling, so let through low frequency rumble..
They're comfortable (albeit only just big enough for my enormous head).

Pros: It is very comfortable. Out of the box the sound was crisp, clear, and great. For the price these headphones are the best. I used them for gaming and I could hear footsteps from a mile away
Cons: Feels cheap and does not fit that snug on on head.
If you're looking for cheap headphones, but still sound great and look good buy these ones.

Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Sennheiser HD 201 3.5mm/ 6.3mm Connector Around-Ear Hi-fi Headphone
Item.Review:
Pros: I own 3 pairs, one for work, one for home, and one for travel. They are the best set under $30 you can ever buy... They are worth $50 to me. Powerful bass, clear treble, and even more perfect with an amp/stereo.
Cons: Don't leave in the sun, the bridge between ear phones will become pliable,

I bought these headphones about a year ago for a small budget home studio, and they performed decently for what I was trying to do, but didn't last very long. The speaker blew on the right side a few months ago, and I don't really care to replace them. For the price, I would consider buying these if you just need a back-up set. Be warned, they make the bass sound much more prominent than many other headphones in this price range, and that is not a good thing. It makes mixing difficult and drowns most everything you're listening to. If I were to say one good thing about them, it would be that I found them to be comfortable.

Pros: Price! $12.99 on shell shocker to my tastes the sound is good for the price and they are pretty much comfortable. I like these better then hd202 because of the comfort and how they built. Maybe a bit less of the lows compared to the hd202 but still enough for me. Oh, and I love the cord! it's made from some type of rubber that is easy to untwist, like an original iphone earbuds.
Cons: none

I use it everyday, and its my first headphones of any sort of quality and its impressive for the cost. the bass is deep and its comfortable. Considering that for the same price, you can get some very low quality earphones, i consider this one of my better purchases.

Pros: I am not an audiophile. With that said, these headphones seem to be very nice. They fit our needs perfectly. We purchased a full-size keyboard for my mom for her birthday and got these to go with it. The headphones sound so natural that I can't tell that the music is coming out of the headphones and not the keyboard. They also do a very good job of insulating sound (keeping music in and noise out) and are comfortable to wear. My mom is thrilled with them.
Cons: None yet.

Pros: For the price i paid (like 14 bucks) there ok. Nice full size headphones.
Cons: I really expected A LOT more from these headphones... They are a bit tight on my head don't know about every one else. I can't get passed how much these are lacking in sounds quality. If you have the sounds low its fine every thing is fine, but when you start to turn it up the sounds get very distorted. the cord is WAY to long.
The packaging its really cheap. You open the box and its just the headphones kinda just thrown in there. the headphones have like the fake leather on the muffs, and after sometime time of wearing they get really hot and uncomfortable.
If you wear GLASSES FORGET ABOUT THESE!!!!!! Because of the tightness of the headphones and the fake leather every t ... ime you move you head it makes this really loud squeaking noise. It is so distracting.
Over all i bought two of these one as a gift and one for myself since they where on sale, and man i felt really bad giving them as a gift. Other than that Newegg always great service SUPER FAST shipping thanks guys! expand » « collapse

Pros: Bought these because they were on sale. They do the job pretty well. Decent mids to highs. Bass is...meh, but I really didn't expect much for 20 dollar head phones. They are definitely worth the 20 dollars though.
Cons: They aren't comfortable for long periods of time. I can't have these on for 3-4 hours without feeling uncomfortable. Especialy if I have my glasses on, they cut that time period even shorter.
The cord is really long. I'd say 8 ft. maybe? Pretty useful for me, but it definitely won't suit everybody's needs. Just keep that in mind.

I really like the design, comfortable to wear while im listing to music or editing a video. The treble and bass come in very clearly, however it could use a little more bass. but for [$] who can complain. The only thing I don't really like is the cheap plastic band on the top, other than thats, I would buy this product again.

Pros: Price ($13 shipped), long cord, comes with gold plated 1/4" adapter (probably would pay about $3 for one of these shipped or if I bought locally), not too tight or loose, fits over my ears just fine.
Cons: Like all those before me I could deal with more bass, distorts at high volumes, gets almost too loud with my computer and not loud enough with my mp3 player, def not as comfy as my Jabra Halos but nothing I've tried comes close to those
Out-of-the-box the bass is somewhat lacking, it is there, just not very deep or prominent. I am going to "break in" the headphones for some time and see if that improves the bass. But as it stands now there is more bass with my cheapy 50 cent Meritline earbuds. OUCH. Everything is very clear though, unless I max out the volume, then ev ... erything sounds distorted.
For the most part, I got these headphones so I can practice with my bass guitar without annoying the neighbors. When these headphones are plugged into my 60w Peavey amp they kick. I have not tried these headphones with my surround sound receiver yet so I cannot comment on that.
Probably not the best choice for computer gamers, I know how you love your boomy air strikes and stuff. Also, anyone who primarily listens to hip hop or bass-heavy music, you will probably disappointed even at this price point. I think the HD 202's on sale for $20-ish might be a better buy than these 201's. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Possibly the best headphones for your buck.
Item.Review:
Pros: Basically everything people were complaining about in the other reviews is unfounded. Bass is fine, volume is fine. Winamp is at 100% volume and windows volume is at 50%, and any louder and it would probably be painful. Also, I have a giant head and its not tight on me at all(I was worried about this one).I paid 13$ shipped, and for that I feel like its a steal. I've bought 80$ headphones that sound the exact same as these. The long cord is also nice and you can twisty tie off some of it to the length you need.
Cons: None for the price. If these were 60-80$ headphones I might have some.
Long cord could be a con for people listening to an mp3 player, but as I said in the pros they could still twisty tie off.

Pros: For the price they sound great. They sound almost to good for the price.
Cons: They don't have as good a sounds as say the HD-280's but that's to be expected at this price. Also I'm a big guy at 6'3" and they do touch my ears. I can last about an hour before they start to bother me.
If you have a nice computer sound card or a decent receiver you can adjust these out to sound really good. If you have no access to an EQ of some sort these headphones will sound tinny and lack bass. I was able to adjust my computers EQ to sound very close to the HD-280 headphones. Only thing I was missing was the HD-280's comfort.

Note: These are OVER ear headphones, not, on-ear as described. I knew that, so they were what I was looking for. The sound quality is great for the price and they are comfortable and well made. Very long lead (3m) is a bit cumbersome, apart from that, just fine.

Item.ReviewTitle: I found something better than this for the same $
Item.Review:
Pros: Look, comfort, lightweight
Cons: Construction quality, poor bass, low output, long cord
I wanted to get a pair of good around the ear headphones under $30, these looked very good and the brand has been usually good quality. When I went to the store I also found the Koss UR20 for the same price and slightly higher specs, so I bought both to see which were better.
After a couple of days of tests I must say these HD201S are a little disappointing. Even though they are comfortable, right size and lightweight, their plastic construction tells you right away that they won't last very long, tiny plastic hinge looks very weak. As far as sound, they have poor bass and low output compared to the great performance I found on the Koss UR20 which have great bass and output ... , plus good construction and flexibility. Both have extreme long cords (8-9.5ft).
On the other hand, the only problem with the UR20 is that they are big compared to the 201s... but if you don't mind the size and look and care more about the sound quality, then check your local Best Buy store and get the Koss UR20 instead. If you think these are too big, then I suggest the JVC flat foldings (over the ear) which are smaller and have better sound, bass output and better quality over the HD201S. Avoid these Sennheiser unless you only want a pair of headphones that look good, no matter the sound quality. expand » « collapse

Pros: +Comfortable +looks great +cheap price +good brand +clear sound
Cons: -VERY LOW SOUND! Ipod standard headphones have BETTER LOUDER SOUND! and no, it's not because they're in ears as compared to these!
I just recently ordered the hd202s from the same manufacturer and will be returning these. The hd202 have louder sound/bass, come with a cord wrapping thingy, and are a bit smaller. I tried them both. Don't be cheap like me and spend a little more on the hd202s you won't be disappointed. Also check out the reviews here comparing both and also check out ama..zon's reviews on the hd202.

Pros: Loved them out of the package. Amazing bass. fairly good sound attenuation (it's not insulation- they are open after all).
I am no audiophile great medium & bass
Cons: Highs & Med are not as strong as some of my other headphones. I think the people who complain they are not loud enough or that they need to make it louder than usual, are missing the Highs & Med.
(I would still buy them again)
Great headphones overall. Better for jazz, rock, and anything with serious bass. Not as good, for acapella

Item.ReviewTitle: Great quality at a low price
Item.Review:
Pros: Pretty lightweight and comfortable on the ears. Sound is crisp and clear for the price.
Cons: Sound seems to bleed out a little at higher volumes.
Great buy. Definitely would recommend to others.

I use the product mostly at school for listening to music between classes. I either plug my headphones into my MP3 player or plug them into the computers at school to watch videos/listen to music.
