These headphones are so comfortable and have great sound coming from them. They are a great value, very stylish, and a great product.

Pros: first of all i like how sick they look, and how light they are. i like to skateboard and they stay on because there so light. other good things are that they sound very clear and crisp. and i love how they fit. they're sooooo comfy. oh and price wise, you can't get any better i think. i payed $41.99 and now there $22.99. like are you freakin kidding me! TOTALLY WORTH IT!!
Cons: welllllll they don't have much base. but there bump thats there plays right and proper. so clear.
wow thx newegg for lowering the price 12 smackers the day i get them :p what ever. i will think of it as a tip for how fast they shipped it across America. they ship from california and i am in vermont and it took 2 days after they got the check.

Pros: I have been listening to a variety of genres on Pandora and these headphones sound great with all kinds of music. I previously owned just some regular headphones (the type that didn't surround your ears) that I needed to replace since the foam was filthy and falling apart. The sound is definitely better and "fuller" sounding since these headphone cover up your ears.
Drowns out ambient noise quite well in case you live in a loud area.
Unlike my previous foam headphones, the material on these feel pretty good.
Terrific price!
Cons: The only con is extended listening of 1hr+ for me requires taking off the headphones for like a minute to let my ears cool off. Otherwise very comfortable fit.

Pros: Great Bass. Cheap. Good Fit.
Just about everything you need in a headphone is there. The cord is like a mile long which I love.
Cons: Midranges are lacking, but an equalizer is available in most programs, but not alwayws games
Great brand, great sound, great price.

Pros: These headphones are very lightweight, and very comfortable. The foam around the ears and on the top bar is soft and you hardly notice they are on after a bit. Excellent sound that is crisp with plenty of bass if you need it.
Cons: None that I know of.
I purchased these headphones to use on my computer to replace my 20 year old Sony headphones that go in the ear. I've used other headphones that cover the ears like these, and these Sennheiser ones are awesome. These headphones are an outstanding value here at Newegg (purchased on the Black Friday sale). In fact I just purchased another set for my parents to replace their old 20 year old set.

Pros: these are made nice, they feel nice. good for big heads. cord is nice and long. they should last long, and won't break in half.
Cons: Very Quiet.
A Cheap 15$ pair of skull candy earbuds would have been a much better buy compared to these for 30. i got these for the 10 ft cord, but these headphones are horrible.
i recommend getting skull candy earbuds, or headphones with a cord extender. --- or getting the speakers replaced in these ha ha..

Pros: Keeps my office mates from bothering me. Fit fairly snug so even though they are not noise cancelling they do block out a lot of external noise. Long cord means I can move all around my large cube without taking off the headphones. Great sound, nice bass levels.
Cons: Now my office mates come into my cube to get my attention.
They fit my head and ears just fine. I can see how they would be uncomfortable to some people if the ear does not fit entirely inside the padded ear dome containment area.

Pros: comfy, stylish
Cons: my small coby earphones sound way better. unless there is a button to press that i aint seeing..i am still waiting on the bass to work.
someone please suggest a good sounding headphone to me.

Pros: Comfortable plush cups, even if you wear glasses all the time. Soundstage is solid, infinitely better than earbuds. Bass is rich but won't cause your inner ear to implode. Comes with a 1/4" adapter so you can get your DJ on. Consistent performance across all volume levels.
Cons: Cord is 8ft long. Not a problem if you use them on your computer or other indoor equipment, but might not make for ideal on-the-go situations unless you have some way to tie up or pack in the long cord.
Obviously there are headphones that sound better, but not at this pricepoint. And since they are so cheap, if something happens to them you can just grab another pair and not think twice about it.

I bought 5 pairs to record a band doing a recording session and everyone liked them. I've tossed out so many cheap headphones before but these are keepers. Nice long cord. They are lightweight and fairly durable if you take care of them. Definitely comfortable to wear. Don't expect hyped/deep bass but great overall sound at a price you won't beat.

Pros: The price. It is attractively priced.
Cons: The sound quality is only acceptable.
Still debating but I "might" return and eat the return shipping fee because I was expecting more from Sennheiser.

Pros: I was very surprised. I think these are great headphones. My pair has very rich sound with full bass. I am impressed with the clarity these hd201's have for being inexpensive. $20 off
Cons: The 9 foot cord might get in the road, but I happen to like it.
Would make a good Christmas gift.

Pros: Great sound, great fit, can wear this for hours and wont bother me even if im wearing my glasses.
Cons: nothing for now.
i have the HD202 got this as a spare, only difference in my opinion is bass. i can really hear everything without having bass overpowering sound. Great buy if you're on a budget and want good sound for, music and gaming.

Pros: Sennheiser has made some fantastic products and I can proudly say that I have had few issues with any of their products over about five years. You honestly can't do better for the money. I play bass guitar, so I need headphones that can deliver solid low-end sound and time and time again they have proven themselves over and over.
Cons: Compared to some of Sennheiser's headphones in the $30-$50 range, these just aren't doing it for me. I've owned many pairs and I've honestly never been this disappointed. However, these just don't deliver in the low end. They dissolve into crackling and that's unexpected from them.
Don't get me wrong, for typical music listening usage, any of their products are amazing and these are honestly fine for about 90% of applications, but for som ... eone going above and beyond normal expectations, I would recommend spending the extra $10-$20 for a better set from them. expand » « collapse

Pros: Comfy. These sound very close to sony mdr xd 100, but more muffled, yet it doesn't bother me that much while listening to my songs, because the overall range is very good. The price is a plus.
Cons: Very thin cabling. Slightly muffled sound compared to sony mdrxd100-which are not as comfy.

Pros: Low Price, Good Sound Quality, Noise Blocking
Cons: They do start to hurt my ears after wearing for more than 5-6 hours.
We just built a new engineering office at work near our two turret presses. After dealing with the noise from them for a couple weeks, I couldn't take it any more and bought a pair of expensive active noise-cancelling headphones. They did nothing to reduce the banging from the turrets. These cheap headphones actually seem like they block more of that type of noise than the $300 headphones I had previously. YMMV.

Pros: covers outside of ears
Cons: a little firm
I use these headphones for my iMac while creating songs or playing music loudly. The bass is definitely not strong but it's still okay for media. I also use with my iPhone. When I have to wear headphones for hours, this quick affordable replacement worked great for me. For the price it's not uncomfortable or too light.

Pros: -Price: Got both pairs for under $20 on sale -Cord: like 10' long, feels pretty sturdy -comfort: Not to heavy or hot. Very comfortable. -Sound: Excellent (for non-audiophile)
Cons: -Cord: Could be protected by stainless steel braid like crazy high end.. but really?
I've always wanted to try full cover the ear phones but didn't want to risk a lot of $ in case I couldn't wear them (I have very sensitive ears, many phones/buds cause pain after 30+ minutes) I got these after I upgraded my sound card to an ASUS one and could hear how inadequate my old phones were. I like these so much that I bought a 2nd pair on sale and put them on the shelf. I use them mostly for gaming but also for some music. Maybe some day I'll buy come $100 ones but currently I c ... an't see why. expand » « collapse
They sound aweful, that's all. Bass rattles the speakers, treble makes my teeth hurt & mid-range is lifeless. "pro music and DJs"? Ya 'avin a laugh. Comfortable though.

Item.ReviewTitle: Great Christmas Gift for a Friend
Item.Review:
Pros: Sennheiser sound quality. Price. Comfort. I gave them a listen after my friend had a while to enjoy them and I really liked what I heard. I was very proud to offer them as a gift. You certainly get more than you pay for with these.
Cons: I wouldn't say they're for audiophiles, but if you just want to hear your music with a nice full range of highs mids and lows, they're great.
I've a set of the 205 open ears for my personal usage for two years now so whenever I want to recommend quality circumaural headphones I always go for Sennheiser.

Pros: Decent headphone for the price. Wont blow you away but are worth the money over trash ones. Quite comfortable considering the price point.
Cons: Bass and lows are a bit lacking which is to be expected with the driver types. Cord get tangled easy as with most entry level headphones.
If you want something better than the cheap stuff but dont want to spend a ton. Or you want comfortable cheap option to your very nice headphones then these are good.

Pros: Price, fit, quality
Cons: None. What you pay for is what you get.
As long as you are not expecting a $200 set of headphones, you will like these just fine. I use them with my MP3 player and my computer and they work just fine for music and the like. If I wanted studio quality headphones I would have bought them, but these are fine for everyday use.

Pros: lightweight, clear sound
Cons: tight fitting, not enough cushion on earpads, uncomfortable after more than an hour
I would prefer a longer cord, but it is probably long enough for most people and I could just use an extension cord if I needed. I bought these as backups while I sent my regular headphones in for service (Tritton ax51 pro). They are ok for the price, but I do not enjoy wearing them for extended periods of time. I also had to set up bass redirect in my x-fi creative sound settings in order to get a reasonable amount of bass.

I've had these babies for years and they just recently broke, but man did I work them. The cables get tangles really easily. The design looks pro. They sound good and are comfortable to wear. Great for shooting and editing video.

Pros: Comfortable, fit nicely over the ears, pretty good range, great for watching movies or playing games.
Cons: As you may read in other reviews, there is an "sssssss" effect. I'm not sure what it's called exactly but S's are exaggerated. Also the cord is really long. It could be louder and the bass a bit boomier (get's drowned out on the bus).
For the price, it's a great value. The range is very wide and the sound is crisp.

This headphones are for home, as they are too big to wear outside. imho, As for the rest - very good sound and perfect value for money. Though i had to return them, as I was looking for "outside" headphones

Pros: Fit over ears perfectly. Sound quality is excellent. Cord is nice and long.
Cons: Some say there is no bass, but it has the right amount.
Really great buy!

Pros: I use these while at work to listen to music for almost 8 hours a day. They are very comfortable and sound quality is very good compared to the price. Songs with deep base however have their pitfalls, but not too bad. Definately would get me another set for home.
Cons: Other than the base limitations at certain frequencies there are no further complaints.

Pros: -Great Deal for the price -comfortable -really long cord -decent sound for the price
Cons: -sound wise these cannot compare to anything that is a step up from this -little bass
compared to the HD 202 from the same manufacturer this cannot compare. I own many other high end headsets but the price drew me to it. If you are looking for a cheap pair of headsets that do not sound like a tin can these are the way to go. Sound wise i am fairly certain you cannot find anything around the price that I got it for (about 10 bucks) that sounds better. I own the HD 202, Sony MDR-XB500 and the Logitech G930 so these could not compare sound wise but they do give an excellent value.

Pros: Inexpensive, sturdy construction, decent quality, ridiculously long cord.
Cons: Ridiculously long cord, muddy sound, poor high frequency response.
I was excited to think I found such a good deal from Sennheiser, a name in headphones I've grown fond of over the years. They've really cheapened their name with this pair, altered my perception of them as audiophiles. Bottom line is that they are alright, and I certainly got what I paid for. Better deal than anything else I'd find on the shelves of brick and mortar for $20, and frankly, I've probably not heard anything much better for the price anywhere. But, I didn't say "Wow" as I had hoped! :(
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.ReviewTitle: i have to say this is a good one
Item.Review:
Pros: long cord (3m), with 6.3mm stereo jack adapter, decent sound quality (considering the price) // you do need a solid sound source to get it, see my comments below
Cons: The product package is "open style". You can open the paper box, tear off one very small type and touch the headphones. Basically, it could be a returned or open-box one, because you cannot tell from the package.
As a comparison, Sennheiser HD 202 II (also sold on newegg.com) has decent package. That headphone is sealed in a hard plastic box, which guarantees to be a new one.
As soon as I tried this HD201 on my laptop, I notice that the one (with 32 ohms) has much lower sound volume than my other regular headphone (with 8 ohms).
With the same media player and the same music track, HD20 ... 1 needs laptop to output 100% to reach the same sound volume as my regular one needs about 75%. I think both the 32 ohms and the 3m long cord contribute to this behavior.
Then, I connected this HD201 to my receiver (Onkyo TX-SR608, also bought from newegg.com) with the included 6.3mm adapter to test with the same sound. When I turned the volume to 80 out of 100 on the receiver, I got the amazing sound with solid bass.
Now the question is how to enjoy this HD201 on my laptop, instead of on a receiver. One workaround for me is to use some MP3 converting software to convert the existing MP3 to MP3 with more loud sound on the target. I am still looking for other solutions. expand » « collapse

These have a good sound and cover around the ears, which is what I wanted.
The wire though is very thin and if touched you can hear the knocking sound, but they were a good price so I'm glad I got these

Pros: This headphone very satisfied my opinion with 12.95 dollars. I know this headphone only a basic type. Satisfied sound quality, and even say it better then I expected.
Cons: No cons for this price.
If someone complains about this headphone at 13 dollars, I would consider you are expect too much, and I wouldn't care about your complains. With this headphone, what you pay, what you get even better. If it is DOA, certainly, the complain would be acceptable otherwise, if it works nothing to say more.

Pros: Plenty of room inside the earpieces
Cons: o m g.. I can't believe Sennheiser actually put their name on these.. I have never heard a worse sounding set of headphones in my life. And I'm 59 years old! Not only are they lacking in bass, there is NONE. 1960's transistor radios sounded better than these..
Run away!! Don't even think of wasting your hard earned $13 on this junk. The simple fact that some reviewers actually thought these were worth the money, astounds me....

Pros: These were free in a bundle with the new 120GB Zune. Decent bass response.
Cons: The highs are very sharp. There is way too much treble and not enough midrange. They sound horrible in games like COD4.
I have a cheap pair of $15 Sony DJ headphones, and they sound better than these when gaming. What do you expect for free I guess? I wouldn't buy these, and I'm glad I didn't.

Pros: I must say, these headphones truly are a steal when you can snag them for $15. I do not have enough experience with headphones to truly discriminate between the sound quality between this unit and another brand or model, yet I am very pleased with these headphones. They're comfortable, very much adjustable for head size, have an abundance of cord length, and most importantly they put out very good quality sound.
Cons: None (I'm content!)
If you are on the fence about purchasing these headphones, pick up a pair when there is a promo-code for them, you won't regret it.

Pros: As people have said, the bass just isn't there for these headphones, but there is very clear sound. For 15 bucks, I use these with my mixer board to hear four separate inputs, and I don't need articulate bass for that.
Cons: No bass, but podcasts and live records don't require I have hefty bass.
Perfect for listening to podcast, cancels out about 50% noise, so if you need more noise cancellation, you'll need to spend more money.

Pros: Fairly clean sound. Comfortable, long cord. Not too heavy.
Cons: Music and games just sound flat and lifeless. Very low bass. Would not recommend for gaming. The audio doesn't pop out at you. The cord doesn't seem that durable. No ferrite cores.
I was told time and time again that these where just fantastic head phones. Maybe people haven't tried anything else. There are much better headphones for the same price range, all around. Decent phones, but they don't live up to the hype.

Pros: Sound quality overall is very good. Lots of bass for those who want that. Comfortable and the cord is really long so you can plug these in to your desktop and still be able to move around.
Cons: Fragile. I left them on the floor (my mistake, I know) and just nudging them with my foot resulted in the headphones breaking. They don't need to be indestructable, but they should be able to hold up to being thrown around here and there.
If you plan on using them with a desktop or are willing to make sure that they're stored out of harm's way, then you really can't beat the price for the audio quality you get. If you need something a bit more robust however, I suggest you consider something else.

Pros: Sound quality is good (especially if you're just trying to upgrade from earbuds) Seem pretty sturdy Cord length is good Price is great!
Cons: Even with the volume turned down, you can hear these headphones from across the room. I bought some over-the-ears because my earbuds were distracting my co-workers, but these headphones are even worse.
Good headphones (especially for the price) as long as you don't mind the people around you hearing your music.

Pros: Very accurate sound reproduction. Good bass response. REALLY LONG CORD! Nicely padded as well. I know it's a cliche, but listening to music with these reveals details I wasn't hearing before.
Cons: None, really.

I purchased the Sennheiser HD 201 headphones for one purpose: so directors could listen to audio takes on location. I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a set of headphones knowing that some directors are pretty careless in handling other people's gear. Based on all the positive reviews for the HD 201 I thought I had found a happy medium between good sound at a disposable price point. Save your money! They're not that great. I wasn't expecting them to match the quality of my HD 25-1 IIs, but I sure expected better than what I got. Poor audio. Cheap thin cable out of each can. In hindsight I wish I had directed this money towards the purchase of a set of Sennheiser HD 280's or a set of Sony MDR-7506's. The axiom you get what you pay for certainly applies here. Pass on this mo ... del and spend a little more. You'll be glad you did. expand » « collapse

Pros: Sound quality is average. Tried them with an assortment of music and i can't complain. Cancel out the noise great and they don't let hardly any sound out for those around who don't want to here my tunes. Fast shipment as always.
Cons: Seem a little cheap. Not a lot of padding around the ear. Plastic is a little squeaky when adjusting the size. May just be because they are new.

He likes the style, long cord, and the thin ear padding of these headphones. He's had others but prefers these. The headphones are Sennheiser HD201 Pro close Back Headphones. Bought these for my son and he thinks they are great! They were recommennded to him by a friend who plays also plays the drums. They both say they have great sound. The drummer Boy says they have great sound. I know when I talk to him he can't hear me so that means they block out the outside noise, which he is a big fan of! The value is great, he says it beats paying the price for Beats Headphones.

Pros: I bought these phones for $18 with a promo code and received them today. I'm no audiophile, but they sound good to me. I'm definitely not a small guy and they fit comfortably on my head. The the earpads feel good and fit well over my ears, blocking quite a bit of ambient sound.
Cons:
Comes with an adapter to fit a full-size headphone jack.

Pros: Senheiser is known for making accurate high definition musical equipment. This is no exception. These headphones are amazing. I've had them for around a year now. Crisp highs, detailed full lows and every detail just adds to the awesomeness. Don't get overpriced $200 beats just to get amplified bass response. Sennheiser is the way to go.
Cons: My pair's ear cushions have gotten somewhat flattened, but it doesn't take away from quality or comfort. just a cosmetic thing when i don't have them on. :) maybe i just overuse them lol but they're still like new.
great headphones. You won't be disappointed with bass, it's very full but not amplified to the point where it will make your nose tickle with the freakin vibrations lol

Pros: I've had these headphones for 3-4 months, and they have worked beautifully from the day I took them out of the box. Not being a huge audiophile, the sound quality is quite reasonable for the price range. These headphones are quite sturdy as well - I've had problems before of cups separating from the headband, but I don't forsee that ever happening with these. I use these headphones almost all the time when on my laptop, and they serve their purpose well. The cord length is also helpful; I've never had a problem with the cord being too short (like I have with other headphones).
Cons: Over a relatively long period of time (say 2-3 hours), these headphones tend to get a bit warm around the ears. It's not incredibly annoying, but you have to remember to take them off for 5-10 ... minutes every now and then. Also, if you're hoping for them to cut down the noise level around you, then you're not looking at the right pair of headphones. I can still hear background noise if I don't have music or a movie playing - they're nowhere near noise-cancelling (but then again, they don't advertise themselves to be).
A great pair of headphones considering the price. These are probably the best headphones I've owned in at least a couple years, and they are the cheapest I've ever bought. Again, if you're looking for studio quality or incredible bass, then they're not what you're looking for. For the casual listener seeking a pair of cheap but sturdy headphones, however, these are ideal. expand » « collapse

Pros: Very affordable, very smooth, clear, nonhyped sound. Perfect for voice work.
Cons: A little large and conspicuous for daily use
The ad copy ("Torturous Bass!!!") is pure baloney. This is not the highest fi but your best choice for voice: Radio listening, translating and transcribing, vocal tracking for recordings, etc. Very clear and smooth. No annoying, fatiguing bass or treble boosts. Outstanding and probably unique.

Pros: These headphones blockout about 60% of outside noise, which is why i bought these headphones in the first place. The cable is long and the headphones are comfortable around your head so it is good for watching something in private from across the room. The sound is decent (in the upper range that these can play).
Cons: There is absolutely no bass and no lower range on these headphones. If you want a comparison, these have less bass than the first generation ipod headphones. However the upper range that it is able to play is clear. I'm not a bass freak by any means, but you can't listen to a lot of songs properly because the lower frequencies are missing.
These are cheap and you will get what you paid for. The sounds that these headphones do produce are very very clear. ... You will NOT suffer from distortion in the sounds, but a lot of the lower frequencies will be missing if you play songs that have them. This is not that much of a big deal if you're not too picky but if you compare it with high quality headphones or speakers, you will really notice the difference. My suggestion is to try the HD202 which people say has more bass. I wish I did, even though I'm fairly happy with my purchase for 15 dollars. expand » « collapse

This purchase was made for my Dad's Christmas. My Dad is a DJ as his job, and he really needed a good pair of headphones. I ordered these because it sounded like a good quality product and just what he needed. He loves them, but the bass is just a bit TOO hard. However, if you like that thing then it is really good!!! Would definitely recommend to a friend, especially at this price!!

Pros: I love to listen to music on the go so i need some good headphones that i didn't really care about. I got these for 20 bucks and i am very satisfied. The bass is decent but only if you crank up the volume on a bass booster setting and that is fine with me. Comfortable for me as well.
Cons: Long cord. Normally i just stuff it in my pocket.

Headphones are decent, they are comfy and a good price compared to other ones out there. The pivoting pads are kinda cool because it improves comfort, but it is also a VERY WEAK spot. Mine broke 2 weeks after purchase. They produce a decent sound, bass is not great but you can hear it. Crisp sound but not loud enough.for the price i'd say they were ok. Recently just acquired a pair of Ear Pollutions for less than these, and they sound SOO much better.

Item.ReviewTitle: Sweet Deal When It Drops Low
Item.Review:
Pros: Great deal when it dropped down to about $13. For that price, you can't beat the sound quality. Great style too, I'm on a college campus where everyone has their $300+ Beats headphones, while at $13 these probably have about 80% the sound quality at 5% of the cost.
Even more amazing with the "Beats" audio equalizer settings found on some HTC phones. For some reason it sounds amazing on those versus my computer.
Cons: The cord is long, but I actually like that since you can use it with objects further away and lay on a bed.
